suppress.notes: See https://github.com/google/guava/issues/4011 Unclear why this DependencyCheck failure has started now for a 2020 CVE, and why it crops up for Gradle builds, but not for Maven builds
See https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-2976 Unclear why this crops up for Gradle build, but not the Maven build. Further, it is not yet an assigned CVE

See https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-4244 Unclear why this DependencyCheck failure has started now for a 2022 CVE, and why it crops up for Gradle builds, but not for Maven builds, and what it has to do with a simple Java project

See https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-4245 Unclear why this DependencyCheck failure has started now for a 2022 CVE, and why it crops up for Gradle builds, but not for Maven builds, and what it has to do with a simple Java project
This CVE is in process of being withdrawn. See https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fgq9-fc3q-vqmw and https://github.com/spotbugs/spotbugs/issues/2670. Spotbugs is the plugin where this came up.
Unrelated CVE describing an issue in the LINE app for Android. False-positive.
